Column Comment.0: FILE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this file; may be a surrogate identifier ifdesired. For PPDM 3.8, the PK of this table was changed to a singleton identifier, sothat a file can be related to an information item or a physical item, as appropriate toyour design.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: DIGITAL FORMAT: The digital format, or predefined order or arrangement of digits.For trace data, may be SEG Y or SEG B, for survey data may be UKOOA or SEG P1etc. For other files, may be XLS, DOC, PDF etc.
Column Comment.3: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.4: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.5: FILE CONTENT: The actual contents of a digital file may be placed in this record.
Column Comment.6: FILE SIZE: the digital size of the file.
Column Comment.7: FILE SIZE UNIT OF MEASURE: KB, MB, GB
Column Comment.8: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.9: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.10: PHYSICAL ITEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifire for a physical item that representsinformation about this file content; used only in cases where a direct link back to aphysical item is desirable.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: APPLICATION NAME: the name of the preferred application that can be used tolaunch the data contained in the blob file.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
